c74object.name: fl.medianfilter~
c74object.digest: Applies a median or other specified percentiled filter to the input
c74object.description: The default percentile is 50% which returns the median. The output is the same length as the input. Each output value is the specified percentile of the surrouding area in the input. The width of the filtering and the edge behaviour are both controllable.

entry.name: /width [int]
entry.description: Sets the width of the filtering in samples.

entry.name: /edges [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the edge behaviour for filtering:
pad - values beyond the edges of the input are read as the padding value.
extend - the edge values are extended infinitely in either direction.
wrap - values are read as wrapped or cyclical.
fold - values are folded at edges without repetition of the edge values.
mirror - values are mirrored at edges with the edge values repeated.
[0] - pad [1] - extend [2] - wrap [3] - fold [4] - mirror

objarg.name: width
objarg.digest: Sets the width of the filtering in samples
objarg.description:
This argument sets the width parameter:
Sets the width of the filtering in samples.

objarg.name: pad
objarg.description:
This argument sets the pad parameter:
Sets the padding value.

objarg.name: edges
objarg.digest: Sets the edge behaviour for filtering
objarg.description:
This argument sets the edges parameter:
Sets the edge behaviour for filtering:
pad - values beyond the edges of the input are read as the padding value.
extend - the edge values are extended infinitely in either direction.
wrap - values are read as wrapped or cyclical.
fold - values are folded at edges without repetition of the edge values.
mirror - values are mirrored at edges with the edge values repeated.

objarg.name: percentile
objarg.description:
This argument sets the percentile parameter:
Sets the percentile to return.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.medianfilter~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.medianfilter~. When set to 0 fl.medianfilter~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.medianfilter~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
